Desc.entry: Provides long or short-term domiciliary care to adults with disabilities or with a range of needs to support them in living independently in their own home. Workers have appropriate skills and training and are employed to provide person-focused care and support to make sure that individual needs and preferences are met. Provides support for a wide range of tasks including cleaning, nutrition and the preparation and cooking of meals, medication, personal care and with any social and leisure activities that individuals may wish to take part in both inside and outside the home. Committed to providing flexible support that is tailored to the individual needs of each person. Registered with the United Kingdom Care Association (UKHCA) and has ongoing links with the Social Care Institute of Excellence (SCIE), Skills for Care, Dignity in Care Champions Network and the National Skills Academy (NSA). Registered and inspected by the Care Quality Commission (CQC).
